author: wrowe
msg: Per suggestion of Martin Kraemer, eliminated unused "Your Name", "Your Company"
screen (Customer Information) from the installer, moved the AllUsers/OnlySelf
choice to the ServerInformation screen.  Introduced full ProductName (including
the version) to the first and last dialogs of each path through the installer.
Per PR7345, changed the execution flags for ResolveServerName back to 193, and
while the ValidateServerName must stay at 65, we call it only on the condition
that WINSOCK2_RESOLVED was toggled (and therefore the .dll runs successfully.)
This is probably a very goofy linkage problem.
Per PR7344, all the .msi's to date would act quite goofy if forward slashes are
given in the path name.  Provide a very loud warning to tell the user to always
choose backslashes when picking an installation folder.
Correct the ALLUSER flag to trip back if the user backs up and changes their
mind, and condition the ApacheAdmin and ApacheNonAdmin shortcuts/registry
components to obey ALLUSER instead of AdminUser.
Correct the tripping when bounding through the sequence table for stopping and
uninstalling a prior "Apache" service, then installing and starting the new
service.  We won't touch the existing service if they are not performing an
ALLUSER install.

author: trawick
msg: fix the type of ap_my_pid and make it static since it is used
in only one file per build (prefork.c or threaded.c)

author: gregames
msg: fix make install so that suexec is installed where the server expects to
find it ( <prefix>/sbin by default).
also enable ./configure --sbindir=DIR to work as advertised.

author: martin
msg: Ignasi writes:
Both mod_ssl and KAME-ipv6 patch sets are adding the
if (fd >= 0) in the FD_SET(fd, &listenfds) on http_main.c.
I think this patch doesn't concert neither to mod_ssl nor to IPv6.
I agree, and I think it avoids a potential core dump too.
Submitted by:	"Roca Carrio, Ignasi" <Ignasi.Roca@fujitsu-siemens.com>

author: martin
msg: Change icon for MSI packages
